greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime p such that p<n and 2n-p is also prime.
comment: Also, values of p from A143697. This follows from the factorization n^2-k^2 = (n-k)(n+k). - _T. D. Noe_, Jan 22 2009
link: P. CAMI, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..60000
mathematica: Table[p=n+1; q=2n-p; While[q>0&&!(PrimeQ[p]&&PrimeQ[q]), p++; q-- ]; q, {n, 4, 100}]
program: PARI) a(n) = {my(p = precprime(n-1)); while(!isprime(2*n-p), p = precprime(p-1)); p;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 22 2016
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Dec 02 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 24 2009 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_ and _T. D. Noe_.
